etymology.description: semantic: 革 + phonetic: 䨣; earlier 會意: 革 + 月.
etymology.interpretation: Early forms combined 革 (“change”) and 月 (“moon”) to depict changes in moonlight. Later 雨 was added and the component 䨣 supplied the bà sound, while 革 remained as the semantic base; the sense shifted over time toward political dominance and hegemony.

examples.chinese: 他崇尚霸权(他崇尚霸權)。
这家公司试图霸占市场(這家公司試圖霸佔市場)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā gōngsī shìtú bàzhàn shìchǎng.
examples.english: This company tries to dominate the market.

examples.chinese: 他的作风很霸道(他的作風很霸道)。
